channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

item.title: What Fish Is Good For Me And The Planet? New Documentary Explores
item.description: April 24, 2017 - In order to investigate how eating fish affects our health as well as the oceans, author and fisherman Paul Greenberg spent a year eating fish every day.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 24, 2017 - In order to investigate how eating fish affects our health as well as the oceans, author and fisherman Paul Greenberg spent a year eating fish every day. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/04/24/525111293/what-fish-is-good-for-me-and-the-planet-new-documentary-explores

item.title: Hacking Lake Erie: Tech Competition Seeks Solutions To Water-Related Problems
item.description: April 24, 2017 - A technology competition seeks solutions to Lake Erie's biggest problems, including harmful algae blooms and aging water systems. Teams in cities around the region are competing for thousands of dollars in prize money and consulting services to create apps and other tools.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 24, 2017 - A technology competition seeks solutions to Lake Erie's biggest problems, including harmful algae blooms and aging water systems. Teams in cities around the region are competing for thousands of dollars in prize money and consulting services to create apps and other tools. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/24/525441604/hacking-lake-erie-tech-competition-seeks-solutions-to-water-related-problems

item.title: Astronaut Peggy Whitson Breaks NASA Record For Most Days In Space
item.description: April 24, 2017 - NASA astronaut Peggy Whitson has now spent more time off-planet than any other American. On Monday morning, the president and Ivanka Trump called Whitson at the International Space Station to congratulate her.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 24, 2017 - NASA astronaut Peggy Whitson has now spent more time off-planet than any other American. On Monday morning, the president and Ivanka Trump called Whitson at the International Space Station to congratulate her. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/24/525441574/astronaut-peggy-whitson-breaks-nasa-record-for-most-days-in-space

item.title: Astronaut Peggy Whitson Sets New NASA Record For Most Days In Space
item.description: April 24, 2017 - When she comes back down to Earth this year, Peggy Whitson will have logged more than 650 days in space. She spoke to President Trump Monday morning.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 24, 2017 - When she comes back down to Earth this year, Peggy Whitson will have logged more than 650 days in space. She spoke to President Trump Monday morning. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/24/525374569/astronaut-peggy-whitson-sets-new-nasa-record-for-most-days-in-space

item.title: Voices From The March For Science
item.description: April 23, 2017 - Thousands of people gathered around the world to show their support for science, after President Trump's cuts to the EPA. We'll hear from folks in some of those countries and around the U.S.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 23, 2017 - Thousands of people gathered around the world to show their support for science, after President Trump's cuts to the EPA. We'll hear from folks in some of those countries and around the U.S. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/23/525320213/voices-from-the-march-for-science

item.title: Cassini Spacecraft Heads To Saturn
item.description: April 23, 2017 - The Cassini spacecraft, launched in 1997, has begun its final trip, which will end in its eventual destruction on Saturn. It recently sent back a picture of Earth from 870 million miles away.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 23, 2017 - The Cassini spacecraft, launched in 1997, has begun its final trip, which will end in its eventual destruction on Saturn. It recently sent back a picture of Earth from 870 million miles away. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/23/525310229/cassini-spacecraft-heads-to-saturn

item.title: Waste Not, Want Not: Why Aren't More Farms Putting Poop To Good Use?
item.description: April 23, 2017 - Digesters convert livestock manure into electricity. Farmers can use it to power their operations or even sell some back to the grid. But some have found the technology too pricey to maintain.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 23, 2017 - Digesters convert livestock manure into electricity. Farmers can use it to power their operations or even sell some back to the grid. But some have found the technology too pricey to maintain. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/04/23/524878531/waste-not-want-not-why-arent-more-farms-putting-poop-to-good-use

item.title: PHOTOS: Scientists Take To Washington To Stress A Nonpartisan Agenda
item.description: April 22, 2017 - The science community feels threatened under the current administration. Researchers, educators and activists took to the nation's capital to say that cuts to scientific funding affect us all.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 22, 2017 - The science community feels threatened under the current administration. Researchers, educators and activists took to the nation's capital to say that cuts to scientific funding affect us all. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/22/525100728/photos-scientists-take-to-washington-to-stress-an-apolitical-agenda

item.title: Out Of The Lab And Into The Streets, Science Community Marches For Science
item.description: April 22, 2017 - Thousands of scientists and their supporters took to the streets to advocate for public support for science and technology today in Washington, D.C., and other cities around the country.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 22, 2017 - Thousands of scientists and their supporters took to the streets to advocate for public support for science and technology today in Washington, D.C., and other cities around the country. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/22/525250799/out-of-the-lab-and-into-the-streets-science-community-marches-for-science

item.title: Ren√©e Elise Goldsberry Hopes 'Henrietta Lacks' Movie Will Start Conversations
item.description: April 22, 2017 - The actress plays a young African-American woman whose cells, which were taken without her knowledge or consent, went on to become "immortal."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 22, 2017 - The actress plays a young African-American woman whose cells, which were taken without her knowledge or consent, went on to become "immortal." http://www.npr.org/2017/04/22/525044439/ren-e-elise-goldsberry-hopes-henrietta-lacks-movie-will-start-conversations

item.title: In A New 'Anti-Science' Era, Bill Nye 'Saves The World' With Same Optimism
item.description: April 22, 2017 - "The Science Guy" dons his lab coat and bow tie uniform yet again, this time, in a a new political context. In his new Netflix series, Nye tackles climate change deniers and beyond.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 22, 2017 - "The Science Guy" dons his lab coat and bow tie uniform yet again, this time, in a a new political context. In his new Netflix series, Nye tackles climate change deniers and beyond. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/22/525065105/in-a-new-anti-science-era-bill-nye-saves-the-world-with-same-optimism

item.title: Saturday's March Aims To Stand Up For Science
item.description: April 22, 2017 - "I think the profession of science is under attack," says one organizer of the worldwide event. "[We've] left that open for politicians to [hijack] science for their own selfish needs."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 22, 2017 - "I think the profession of science is under attack," says one organizer of the worldwide event. "[We've] left that open for politicians to [hijack] science for their own selfish needs." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/22/525112932/saturdays-march-aims-to-stand-up-for-science

item.title: Can Placebos Work If You Know They're Placebos?
item.description: April 22, 2017 - NPR's Mary Louise Kelly asks writer Robert Siegel about "open label placebos" and whether placebos work even when patients know they're placebos. He wrote about his experience in Smithsonian Magazine.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 22, 2017 - NPR's Mary Louise Kelly asks writer Robert Siegel about "open label placebos" and whether placebos work even when patients know they're placebos. He wrote about his experience in Smithsonian Magazine. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/22/525188097/can-placebos-work-if-you-know-theyre-placebos

item.title: First Step To 'Eco-Grieving' Over Climate Change? Admit There's A Problem
item.description: April 22, 2017 - Psychologists say anxiety over climate change is making some people feel overwhelmed. To talk through their worries, a group in Utah is meeting weekly and the idea has drawn interest in other states.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 22, 2017 - Psychologists say anxiety over climate change is making some people feel overwhelmed. To talk through their worries, a group in Utah is meeting weekly and the idea has drawn interest in other states. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/22/524557600/first-step-to-eco-grieving-over-climate-change-admit-theres-a-problem

item.title: An Organizer Speaks About Reasons For A 'March For Science'
item.description:
April 22, 2017 - NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with Lucky Tran, organizer of today's March for Science, occurring in a number of cities around the world.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/04/22/525188027/an-organizer-speaks-about-reasons-for-a-march-for-science
